messages.author: Evan Martin
messages.text:
You should use:
http://library.gnome.org/devel/gtk/unstable/GtkEntry.html#GtkEntry-activate

"The default bindings for this signal are all forms of the Enter key."

messages.author: Evan Martin
messages.text: I think you shoudl instead call up through a browser API and have it contact the contents instead of going to the contents directly.  (Consider that conceptually a url in here could cause the browser to switch the kind of TabContents we're using.)

messages.author: Elliot Glaysher
messages.text:
On 2009/02/18 00:08:22, Evan Martin wrote:
> You should use:
> http://library.gnome.org/devel/gtk/unstable/GtkEntry.html#GtkEntry-activate
> 
> "The default bindings for this signal are all forms of the Enter key."

I looked at that signal, but didn't use it because is says that "Applications should not connect to it".

messages.author: Elliot Glaysher
messages.text:
On 2009/02/18 00:08:22, Evan Martin wrote:
> I think you shoudl instead call up through a browser API and have it contact the
> contents instead of going to the contents directly.  (Consider that conceptually
> a url in here could cause the browser to switch the kind of TabContents we're
> using.)

Done.

messages.author: Evan Martin
messages.text: Can you pick a more specific name?  E.g. UpdateFromTabContents or some such.

messages.author: Elliot Glaysher
messages.text:
On 2009/02/18 00:08:22, Evan Martin wrote:
> Can you pick a more specific name?  E.g. UpdateFromTabContents or some such.

Done. (I picked Update() for parity with the windows equivalent class.)
